data.title: Lake Johnson Waterfront Center

data.meta_img: https://raleighnc.govWaterfront center exterior Lake Johnson parks
data.text:
Amenities

Access to Greenway and Park Trails

Direct access to park's trail system

A short 15-minute walk to the Thomas G. Crowder Woodland Center

Walnut Creek Trail

Fishing Pole Loaner

Check out cane (bamboo) poles and/or kids' tackle boxes for free.

Please note that cane poles do not use reels.

You must provide your own bait.

Wildlife Viewing

Sit on our deck and observe the wildlife on and around the lake.

Boating

Boat Rentals are now available through a third-party vendor Wake Rack. Kayaks and Stand Up Paddleboards (SUPs) are located near the Waterfront Center in lockers. Reserve Equipment Online.

Want to know more about the process and how to reserve boats?

Visit Wake Rack's website and learn everything there is to know about the process. And don't forget to check the Lake Wheeler location as well.

Lake Johnson Park will also have programmatic opportunities this summer to get you on the water. Program offerings will provide boating equipment to patrons for each activity. Boat offerings include basic lessons and tours of the lake. Register on RecLink for Paddling Programs.

Personal Boat Launches

Personal paddle craft may be launched from Lake Johnson's Waterfront Center. Launches are not available when the Waterfront Program Center closed. Car-top boats only. No gas-powered motors.

Launch Hours: 8 a.m. to 30 minutes before closing

Daily Launch Fee

Resident: $5

Non-Resident: $7

Active Adult (62+): $3

New Annual Pass (Jan.–Dec.)

Resident: $125

Non-resident: $175

Active Adult (62+): $75

Programs

Join us for one of our many programs offered at Lake Johnson Waterfront Center! The facility offers seasonal paddling, outdoor recreation, nature, and fitness programs.

Facility Rentals

919-996-3141

lakejohnsonrentals@raleighnc.gov

Rental Information

Request your rental online using RecLink.

All complete permit requests are processed in the order in which they are received. Please allow 7 business days for forms to be processed.

All permits must be submitted 6 weeks to 6 months in advance of the event date.

For more information about renting our venues, please see our Facility Rentals Brochure.

Take note: Requests will be subject to staff approval. Upon approval, payment will be required to confirm the reservation. Your reservation is not finalized until you receive confirmation of your payment.

It is recommended to review the Lake Johnson Indoor Facility Rules and the Lake Johnson Park Picnic Shelter Rules prior to submitting a rental request for either the Waterfront Center or booking a shelter rental.

Waterfront Center Conference Room

This spacious room features a beautiful vaulted ceiling with a panoramic view of the lake.

$75/hour (2-hour minimum)

Max Capacity: 50 people

Dimensions: 23' × 35'

Conference Room/Veranda Combo

Add the covered deck area to your rental and bring an outdoor component that is protected from the elements.

$105/hour (2-hour minimum)

Max Capacity: 50 people

Conference Room/Veranda/Deck Combo

Expand your conference room/veranda rental to include most of the deck ideal for outdoor games like cornhole.

$135/hour (2-hour minimum)

Max Capacity: 50 people

Waterfront Center Rental Fees

Fee Information Application Fee

$15

Non-refundable

Setup/Clean-up Fee

$40

Service includes tables & chairs set up prior to the event based on the number of attendants and cleanup of tables, chairs, and/or room after the event.

Personal layouts and decorations are the responsibility of the rental party and must take place during paid rental time.

Damage Deposit

$100

Portions of the deposit may be kept for excessive cleaning, damage, and/or failure to adhere to the rental contract.

Supervision Fee

$60/hour

Fee applies to all hours outside of normal operational hours.

Alcohol Permit Fee

$100

Alcohol allowed only with an approved permit. Permit allows for consumption of only beer, wine, and champagne. No spirits or liquors.

Consumption of alcohol permitted only in rented spaces.

Alcohol permit must be submitted and paid a minimum of 21 business days in advance of the event date for approval. Submission does not guarantee approval of the permit.

Fee non-refundable after the permit is submitted.

Request your rental online using RecLink or by reaching out to the facility.

Take note: Requests will be subject to staff approval. Upon approval, payment will be required to confirm the reservation. Your reservation is not finalized until you receive confirmation of your payment.

Shelters

Rent a shelter online using RecLink.

Take note: Your reservation is not finalized until you receive confirmation of your payment.

Small Shelters

$10/hour (2-hour minimum)

Max. capacity: 15 people

Spruce Shelter: Adjacent to bathrooms, ADA accessible

Hemlock Shelter: Approximately .2 miles from bathrooms, not ADA accessible

Medium Shelter

$12/hour (2-hour minimum)

Max capacity: 30 people

Longleaf Shelter: Approximately .3 miles from the bathrooms, not ADA accessible

Shelter Rules

Alcohol is not permitted at any shelter.

Shelters and grills are to be used on a first-come, first-served basis unless rented.

All shelters and grills are closed at sunset and should be vacated at that time.

View other shelter locations
